com.taursys.model
Interface CheckboxModel

All Superinterfaces:
TextModel
All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultCheckboxModel
public interface CheckboxModel
extends TextModel

CheckboxModel is a model which holds a selected/unselected state.

When the setSelected method is invoked with a true, then the selectedValue will be stored as the text value for the control. When the setSelected method is invoked with a false, then the unselectedValue will be stored as the text value for the control.

If the setText method is invoked directly, the value passed to it must be a known state text value, otherwise an UnknownStateValueException will occur.

This model does not support null. While the underlying value holder may initially contain null, any setText or setSelected operation will force a text representation of the state to be stored in the value holder. A null value in the value holder is treated as unselected by the isSelected and getText methods.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Marty Phelan

getText

public java.lang.String getText()
                         throws UnknownStateValueException,
                                ModelException
Returns text/display value of current state. If the underlying valueHolder value is null, the unselectedValue will be returned.
Specified by:
getText in interface TextModel
Throws:
UnknownStateValueException - if the given value does not match a known state text value.
